page.title: 18THE 'GOTH'
page.content:
One of the public houses in Kinglassie is run along rather unusual lines, which are found in other former mining villages in Fife. The {Kinglassie Public House Society} {Limited}or{'GOTH'}as it is locally known was formed in 1922. The Society built the Public House at a cost of Â£2000 and the money was raised by an {issue of shares}costing Â£1 each.
People could buy up to{Â£200}worth of shares and thus become a member of the society which entitled them to voting powers in the running of the 'Goth'.
The{profits}from the pub should be split as follows - 7.5% of profits is distributed amongst the shareholders and part of the remainder is used for 'purposes of public utility' in Kinglassie and neighbourhood.
